The exact mechanism by which <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulates transcription of different genes is presently unknown .

Here , we report that stimulation through the IL-2R induced tyrosine phosphorylation and subsequent nuclear translocation of <extra_id_0> stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a newly identified member of the signal transducers and activators of transcription ( STAT ) family of proteins .

This protein had an apparent molecular mass of 84 kDa and was not recognized by <extra_id_0> stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or stat1 mAb or antisera .
